svcproc.title: SPICER TIE ROD END REPLACEMENT CRITERIA (Spicer Heavy Axle uses only full ball type tie rod ends.)

para.emph: This Service Bulletin contains information and instructions to check tie rod end conditions.

step1.para: Carefully wipe seal clean and examine for splits or tears that allow contaminants into the socket.
If seal is acceptable, shake tie rod assembly by hand only.

caution.para: Prying on steering linkage can result in damage. False indication of looseness can be created.

step1.para: If looseness is detected, set up a dial indicator as shown in Figure 1. Jack up that side of the axle and measure movement at the tie rod end. Move the tire in and out as illustrated in Figure 1.

note.para: C-clamp setup is recommended for testing the tie rod end for looseness.

step1.para: The tie rod end should be replaced if a reading of .030" or more is taken. Replace tie rod end at the next service interval.

note.para: We no longer recommend removal of the tapered stud from the arm to check rotating torque. This may damage the seal or socket assembly. The full boot clamped seal that is popular in today's product can give false rotating torque readings.
